title: 2015_22 KVPY 2015 Preparations-2
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the slope of one of the lines represented by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4a{ x }^{ 2 }+xy+4{ y }^{ 2 }=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the square of the other, then what is the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"More questions related to KVPY?","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since we have a homogenous second degree equation representing a pair of straight lines, therefore the constituent lines must both pass through origin. Let the equations of these lines be"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y = m_1 x \\ y = m_2 x "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the constraint given in the problem, WLOG we can assume that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m_1 = {m_2}^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we have"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} 4ax^2 + xy + 4y^2 &= (y-m_1 x)(y-m_2 x) \\ &= y^2 + xy(-m_1-m_2) + m_1 m_2 x^2 \\ &= y^2 + xy(-{m_2}^2-m_2) + {m_2}^3 x^2 \end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since both these equations represent the same equation of a pair of straight lines, therefore, their coefficients must be in equal ratio, i.e.,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \dfrac{4a}{{m_2}^3} = \dfrac{1}{-({m_2}^2 + m_2)} = \dfrac{4}{1} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} \dfrac{1}{-({m_2}^2 + m_2)} = 4 & \implies 1 = -4 {m_2}^2 - 4 m_2 \\ & \implies 4{m_2}^2 + 4m_2 +1 = 0 \\ & \implies {(2m_2 + 1)}^2 = 0 \\ & \implies m_2 = - \dfrac 12 \end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \dfrac{4a}{{m_2}^3} = 4 \implies a = {m_2}^3 \implies a = {\left( - \dfrac 12 \right)}^3 = - \dfrac 18 = \boxed{-0.125}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: #2015_23 Riemann is hiding?
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f\left( n \right) =\frac { 1 }{ n } { \big\{ (2n+1)(2n+2)\ldots(2n+n) \big\}  }^{ 1/n },"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"then what is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \lim _{ n\rightarrow \infty  }{ f\left( n \right)  }? "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"More questions related to KVPY:","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]}]}]}

"},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Anandhu Raj"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/anandhu-59jwn4/"}]},{"type":"text","text":"  can u change the name of the questions as they r not meant only for kvpy aspirants. title: #2015_25 KVPY 2015 preparations-5

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The function will be crescent on a [a,b] interval if the derivative of is positive in every x that is on [a,b]"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=x^3-3ax^2+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f'(x)=3x^2-6ax+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The problem asks what can be said if the "},{"type":"text","text":"derivative","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" of the function is strictly increasing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\forall x>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f''(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is always > 0 when this happens"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f''(x)=6x-6a>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x-a>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Lemma: if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for every "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where k is constant, then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n\leq k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Proof: suppose "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n>k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=\frac{n+k}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"However, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" does not hold, so it is impossible for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n>k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n\leq k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",then, by my lemma, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{a \leq 0}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
